snippet: Neither the police nor Coast Guard officials could say with certainty just what had caused the boat to capsize, killing a boy and two girls.
abstract: Neither police nor Coast Guard officials can say with certainly what caused a 34-foot power boat with 27 passengers to capsize in the Long Island Sound after a July 4th fireworks show; three children drowned inside the cabin and 24 others were rescued; much of the speculation about the accident centers on the boat being overcrowded, but authorities say they have not ruled out other factors.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alain Delaquérière, Randy Leonard, Angela Macropoulos, Nate Schweber and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: Neither the police nor Coast Guard officials could say with certainty just what had caused the boat to capsize, killing a boy and two girls.

headline.seo: 3 Children Die in Long Island Boating Accident
headline.main: A Packed Boat, a Celebration, a Deadly Turn
headline.print_headline: A Packed Boat, A Celebration, A Deadly Turn
